name: The Crumbling Tower
pages:
Research Notes #17

Today, after crossing some mountains, I spotted a bizarre construction in the distance, perhaps dating back to the bygone era of Growsseth.

It was a tower hovering in the air, held down by mere

chains, perhaps meant to be transported elsewhere if needed?
But even the entrance was in the sky, and the only way up was via floating stairs, so either it wasn't meant to be in that state, or these people really had some masochism issues.
The bruises on my backside suggest this

perhaps I should translate them.

As for the "roof", or what's left of it, there I found a diary.

This was written in our language, but the content was burned, with still some traces of blue embers.
From the diary, I gather that whoever

lived there had created an ancient form of the enchanting table used nowadays with a design they write they "dreamed" of, but also that they were frightened, or perhaps just went mad.

Come to think of it, I can't remember the

last time I dreamt.

Or if I ever did.
